Key Match Events: Bobby Witt Jr. hit a tiebreaking single in a four-run eighth inning to lift the Kansas City Royals over the Minnesota Twins 4-2.
José Miranda hit a two-out RBI triple in the third and scored on Matt Wallner’s double off Alec Marsh.
Pre-Game Insights: Minnesota RHP Simeon Woods Richardson (5-3, 3.95 ERA) starts Sunday against Kansas City RHP Michael Wacha (11-7, 3.50 ERA).
Post-Match Reflections: Kansas City manager Matt Quatraro praised the quality of at-bats against Jhoan Durán, saying 'The quality of at-bats against Duran was outstanding.'
Twins manager Rocco Baldelli expressed frustration after the loss, saying 'When you’ve got a two-run lead in the eighth inning, you should win the game. Period.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kansas City Royals opened a 1 1/2-game lead over the Twins for the second AL wild card.
The Royals won their third straight following a season-high, seven-game losing streak.
Others: Royals right-hander Dan Altavilla cleared waivers and was assigned outright to Triple-A Omaha.
1B Carlos Santana left in the bottom of the sixth inning with an unspecified illness and was replaced by Kyle Farmer.
